title: Christina Little Riford - 48 Claremont Ave, Tonawanda, NY - Complaint #24-423978 - (June 6, 2024) - "Welfare Check"

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

To the Records Access Officer,

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law (Public Officers Law, Article 6), I respectfully request copies of all records related to **Complaint #24-423978**, received on or about **June 6, 2024**, involving a police response described as a “check welfare” for Christina Little Riford at or near ** 48 Claremont Avenue, Town of Tonawanda**.

This request includes, but is not limited to:

1. The complete incident report, including any narratives, supplements, follow-up reports, and disposition records
2. All Computer Aided Dispatch (CAD) records, call logs, and time stamps associated with this incident

We've included a PDF copy of the complaint. 

If any portion of the requested records is withheld or redacted, please provide the statutory justification for each redaction as required under Public Officers Law §87(2), and release all reasonably segregable portions of the records.

Thank you for your attention to this matter.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

The Riford Family

communications.subject: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: JPD sUAS Reports
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

1.  The Joplin Police Department's annual sUAS reports from 2017 to present.
2.  The location these reports are published


To provide context, we have reason to believe these records exist because the police department policy on use of sUAS devices states that an annual report shall be published. Policy located here. The relevant text is in paragraph 3 of section E:


3.  The Chief of Police or his or her designee shall publish an annual report documenting the agency’s deployment and use of sUAS devices.
    

We have been unable to locate these reports.

Since these reports are supposed to be easily accessible to the public we request the City waive all fees for this request. We request the City consider this request to waive fees despite the blanket policy of not waiving fees.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Michael

title: Request for Public Records - Determinations from Building Department

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Request for Public Records - Determinations from Building Department
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

All written communications prepared, issued, sent, drafted, or approved by the Town of Marlborough Building Department from May 1, 2025 to the present that state, reflect, or communicate the Building Department’s position, conclusion, finding, determination, interpretation, directive, or decision regarding any person, property, complaint, incident, alleged violation, application, permit, certificate, inspection, enforcement matter, or code-related issue (collectively, “Determination Records”), whether or not such documents are labeled or styled as a “determination.” This includes, but is not limited to, records pertaining to Buttermilk Falls Inn, 39 Main St., Orchards on the Hudson, or Marlborough Resort.

This request expressly includes, without limitation, any document styled or characterized as an “opinion,” “interpretation,” “finding,” “determination,” “decision,” “directive,” “notice,” “letter,” “email,” “memorandum,” “report,” or similar, and any transmittal that attaches, forwards, summarizes, or restates the substance of a Determination Record.

This request further includes all responsive records regardless of where maintained, including records created, transmitted, or stored using personal email accounts, personal mobile phones, text messaging, messaging applications, cloud services, or other non-Town devices or accounts, to the extent such records relate to Town business.

Upon completion of production, please certify in writing that the production is complete and that no additional responsive Determination Records exist within the custody or control of the Town, including records maintained on personal devices or accounts as described above.

If any records are withheld or redacted, please identify the statutory basis for each withholding with particularity, and identify the categories of records withheld and the date ranges covered.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Mr. Churchill

title: George W. Bush Presidential Library: DNS Vulnerability (Kaminsky Bug) and National Security Briefings (2008-2009)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: George W. Bush Presidential Library: DNS Vulnerability (Kaminsky Bug) and National Security Briefings (2008-2009)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to and copies of all records created, received, or maintained by the George W. Bush Administration regarding the Domain Name System (DNS) vulnerability discovered by security researcher Dan Kaminsky in 2008.

For guidance: http://unixwiz.net/techtips/iguide-kaminsky-dns-vuln.html The Kaminsky bug has been described as a "9/11" level issue in the internet's architecture. 

Scope of Search (Electronic Records): I specifically request that a search for responsive electronic communications be conducted across the following email domains and systems:

@who.eop.gov (White House Office)
@nsc.eop.gov (National Security Council)
@ovp.eop.gov (Office of the Vice President)
@gwb43.com (RNC-hosted domain utilized by Bush Administration staff)


Specifically, I am requesting:

Briefing Materials & Memos: All briefing papers, memoranda, audio recordings, video recordings, and slide presentations prepared for the National Security Council (NSC), the Homeland Security Council (HSC), and the Office of Science and Technology Policy (OSTP) between July 1, 2008, and January 20, 2009, regarding the technical nature of the DNS vulnerability and its potential impact on critical infrastructure.

Agency Correspondence: Communications between the White House and the Department of Commerce (NTIA), the Department of Homeland Security (DHS/US-CERT), and the National Security Agency (NSA) regarding the coordinated secret patching effort prior to the public disclosure in August 2008.

National Security Impact Assessments: Records discussing the vulnerability's implications for the Root Zone of the DNS and the government's decision to initiate a formal "Notice of Inquiry" in October 2008 regarding the signing of the Root Zone.

Meeting Minutes: Records of any meetings involving the Cybersecurity and Communications Reliability Board or the President’s National Security Telecommunications Advisory Committee (NSTAC) where Dan Kaminsky’s research was discussed.

Individual Search Parameters: Please prioritize a search of the email records and digital files of the following individuals, regardless of the domain suffix used:

Melissa Hathaway (Senior Director for Cyberspace) 
Robert Knake (National Security Council staff)
Paul Kurtz (Homeland Security Council)
Jack Vaughn (Director for Cybersecurity Policy)

Petitioner Status: I am a researcher and this request is made for non-commercial, historical purposes. The disclosure of this information is in the public interest as it provides transparency regarding the federal government's role in securing the internet's core architecture.

If certain parts of this request or certain portions must be redacted please provide any reasonable segregable portion of a requested record after removing or redacting those portions claimed to be exempt, explain in writing the justification for redacting the record, indicate the extent of any redactions on the portion of the record which is made available or published and where technically feasible indicate on the redacted portion itself the specific exemption(s) claimed.

Thank you for the George W. Bush Presidential Library's commitment to transparency. Records related to the DNS Vulnerability are of huge historical importance. I look forward to working together in having his request resolved.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

title: Joplin City Attorney Flock Approval and Terms

communications.subject: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: Joplin City Attorney Flock Approval and Terms
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting any record indicating approval of the Flock contracts by the City Attorney's Office.  These contracts were signed on 12/7/2023 and 12/9/2024 by city employees. I have reason to believe these records should exist because according to Article VI of the Joplin Home Rule Charter, the City Attorney is required to approve of the form of all contracts. The charter indicates this approval should be marked on the contract, but since it is not I must assume the record exists elsewhere.

In addition I am requesting the terms and conditions the City of Joplin agreed to in the contract dated 12/9/2024.  These terms are hosted online and are changed by Flock at will and without notice.  The current terms online are not the same terms agreed to by The City.  Archiving of the terms by archive.org is also not possible.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Michael

communications.subject: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: JPD sUAS Report Metadata
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

The metadata from the file system where the JPD sSUAS reports reside.  This data is to include, file name, creation time, modify time, and other fields.  Under Missouri sunshine law I request this data be provided in screenshot form from the system where the files reside for safe keeping.  

Metadata, is "data about data." By the very existence of data, all manner of other data is created about that data. When a file is created, numerous records are created about that file in the file system and within the file itself. These electronic records that describe facts about JPD sUAS reports are what I am requesting. Anyone in the Joplin IT department will definitely be able to assist with this very brief task if it is not understood by the recipient.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to M.G.L. c. 66, § 10, I request copies of all records relating to any actual, proposed, draft, interim, or contemplated agreement or arrangement between the City of Boston (including any department, office, or agency) and the Boston Family Days / Boston Family Museum, including but not limited to:

1. All draft agreements, whether complete or incomplete, including all versions and revisions.


2. Any memoranda of understanding, term sheets, letters of intent, side letters, or informal written arrangements, whether draft or final.


3. All emails, attachments, and correspondence discussing proposed terms, scope, obligations, indemnification, insurance, licensing, access, or use of City property.


4. Internal City records reflecting approval, review, negotiation, or authorization of any such arrangement, whether or not a final agreement was executed.


5. Any documents reflecting an agreement in principle, course of dealing, or operational understanding, regardless of whether the documents are labeled as an “agreement.”



This request includes records in draft form and records that were never finalized or executed.

If any portion of the requested records is withheld, please provide a detailed exemption log identifying each record withheld or redacted, the specific statutory exemption claimed, and a brief explanation of how the exemption applies.

If no responsive records exist for any category above, please confirm that fact in writing and identify the custodians and systems searched.

Please provide the records electronically. If fees are anticipated, please provide a detailed written fee estimate before proceeding.

Thank you.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brian McCarter

communications.subject: RE: Oregon Public Records Law Request: Banned books list (Department of Corrections)
communications.communication:
Good morning,

We are happy to announce the ODOC has upgraded to an online public records request portal, GovQA, that is now our central location to process public records requests through.  Therefore, we are no longer processing records requests that come in through resource inboxes (such as the DOC General Public Record Requests).

We kindly ask that you use the following link to create a GovQA account and submit your request.  This new portal will streamline the processing of records.

Please see the following link to GovQA to the "Submit a Records Request" area Public Records Requests | Oregon Department of Corrections<https://oregondoc.govqa.us/WEBAPP/_rs/(S(erfwg1qlil3uvveemnxer342))/supporthome.aspx>, or more general information can be found in my signature line.

Sincerely,

[cid:image001.jpg@01DC91BA.3F4567D0]
Laura Sterling
Public Records Analyst
Legal Affairs Unit
3723 Fairview Industrial Dr. SE, Suite 200
Salem, OR 97310
Cell: 971-375-5381
www.oregon.gov/DOC

The Oregon Department of Corrections has transitioned to an online public records request portal, GovQA. Please visit the ODOC website for more information: Department of Corrections : Public Record Requests : Research and Information Requests : State of Oregon<https://www.oregon.gov/doc/research-and-requests/Pages/public-records.aspx>

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: R000920-013026
communications.communication:
Dear Dillon Bergin: In accordance with K.S.A. 45-218 (d), we have begun the process of determining if we possess any public records meeting the terms of your request and how best to proceed. Soon we will provide you with one or more of the following:  
  *  Copies of the requested public records. 
  *  A statement concerning our inability to locate any public records meeting the terms of your request. 
  *  A request for additional clarification concerning the types of records or information you are seeking. Record requests that can be provided with less than one hour of staff time will not be billed for labor. If we determine that our office possesses the public records you request, but are voluminous, difficult to locate, and/or contain information that may include open and closed information, we will provide you with a written estimate of the fees that we will require be pre-paid in order to pay for the actual costs associated with (a) locating and/or retrieving the public records from storage, (b) staff time spent in assisting with making copies of the records, including staff time spent examining the records for possible closure and/or redaction, and (c) copying and mailing the requested public records. In addition to billing for labor that exceed one hour of staff time, the following rates shall apply: 
 
 Copies, 25 cents per page after 100 pages 
 Staff time will be charged at the rate of pay for each person whose time is used in order to assist and/or respond to a specific request. This may include the time spent to access records maintained on computer facilities, review records to determine whether closure exceptions apply and /or to redact open from closed information. For the purpose of transparency, our rates are as follows: general staff time will be charged at $20 per hour, and information technology (IT) services and Legal staff services will be charged at $38 per hour. 
 Additional fees may be assessed if any other costs are incurred by KDOC in connection with complying with a record request. KDOC will provide an estimate of the fees which shall be paid prior to the department gathering the records. In order to ensure payment, the final cost of providing access to or furnishing copies must be paid before the records are provided. If the final cost is less than the estimate, the requestor will be reimbursed for the difference. 5. If we determine that we do possess the records, but that the records are subject to closure by law, we will provide you with that information with a written citation to the laws allowing or requiring that type of public record to be closed.

title: Public Records Request – Five Below, Inc. (Post-Inspection Communications)

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Public Records Request – Five Below, Inc. (Post-Inspection Communications)
communications.communication:
Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I request copies of all public records held by the Michigan Department of Agriculture and Rural Development from November 1, 2025 to present relating to Five Below, Inc., other than routine inspection reports already produced.

Specifically, this request seeks:

Any communications (emails, letters, memoranda, notes) between MDARD staff and Five Below, Inc. or its representatives following inspection findings

Any communications between MDARD and the Michigan Department of Attorney General referencing Five Below, Inc., Scanner Law compliance, or post-inspection status

Any internal MDARD communications discussing Five Below’s compliance, remediation, persistence, or repeat inspection outcomes

This request is not intended to duplicate previously produced inspection reports, but to identify any related communications or records created outside of the inspection reports themselves.

If no such records exist, please confirm that fact in writing.

Records in electronic format are requested where available.

title: Public Records Request – Five Below, Inc. (Scanner Law Compliance Records)

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Public Records Request – Five Below, Inc. (Scanner Law Compliance Records)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Copies of public records held by the Michigan Department of Attorney General from November 1, 2025 to present that reference or relate to Five Below, Inc. and Michigan Scanner Law (MCL 445.353 et seq.) compliance.

This request is limited to records that include one or more of the following:

Any written assurances, representations, remediation descriptions, or compliance statements made by Five Below, Inc. or its representatives to the Attorney General’s Office following the November 2025 Notice of Intended Action.

Any agreements, settlement discussions, assurances of voluntary compliance (AVC), assurances of discontinuance (AOD), corrective action frameworks, or compliance plans (formal or informal), including drafts.

Any correspondence (emails, letters, memoranda) between the Attorney General’s Office and Five Below, Inc. or its legal counsel regarding Scanner Law pricing compliance or remediation after December 15, 2025.

Any internal Attorney General communications that evaluate, summarize, or reference Five Below’s post-notice compliance status.

This request does not seek investigative strategy or attorney work product beyond what is required to be disclosed under FOIA.

Records may be provided electronically. If any portion is withheld, please identify the specific statutory exemption relied upon.

I request a waiver of fees as the records are sought in the public interest and for informational purposes.

Thank you for your assistance.

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Virginia State University Policies
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. A copy of VSU Student Honor Code/Code of Ethics covering lying, cheating, stealing, plagiarism, etc.  
2. A copy of VSU Student Honor/Code of Ethics System detailing how violations of the Honor Code/Student Code of Ethics relating to lying, cheating, stealing, plagiarism, etc. are reported, charged, adjudicated with the range of sanctions and who receives reports and conducts the adjudication.
3. ROTC Commissioning rates by service from 2019 to present by race and gender.
4. Admissions policies, including any diversity goals or objectives by race and gender.
5. Copy of VCU's DEI policy and trainings, as well as whether student attendance is required.
6. Admissions data, including applications, acceptances, enrollment by race and gender from AY 2019 - 2020 - Present
7. Student retention data by class, race, and gender, from AY 2019 - 2020 - Present
8. Amount of funding received from the Virginia State University Alumni Association, VCU Foundation or related alumni groups, funds and/or endowments in total and as a percentage of the University's overall funding from AY 2019 - 2020 - Present
9. Any current concept papers or planning documents, reports or other matrials on the subject of the VSU BOV taking over governance f the Virginia Military Institute

The requested records are reasonably believed to be immediately available within existing records and, therefore, should be provided within the 5-day statutory requirement under the Virginia FOIA.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Anonymous.

communications.subject: RE: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Virginia State University Policies
communications.communication:
Good Evening:

This message acknowledges receipt of your email.

Pursuant to Virginia Code § 2.2 - 3704 (A), FOIA is available to "citizens of the Commonwealth, representatives of newspapers and magazines with circulation in the Commonwealth, and representatives of radio and television stations broadcasting in or into the Commonwealth." Accordingly, please provide a copy of your driver's license with a verified Virginia address.

Kind regards,

VSU FOIA Administrator

title: DARPA: Atomic Machines, Inc. Contracts and OTA Records

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: DARPA: Atomic Machines, Inc. Contracts and OTA Records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all records relating to contracts, grants, and "Other Transaction Authority" (OTA) agreements between DARPA and Atomic Machines, Inc. (https://www.atomicmachines.com) (DUNS: 117144907; CAGE Code: 8D7X8) or any subsidiary.

Specifically, I am requesting:

Agreement Documentation: Copies of all awarded contracts, grant agreements, and Other Transaction (OT) agreements (including Research OTs under 10 U.S.C. § 4021 and Prototype OTs under 10 U.S.C. § 4022).

Proposals & White Papers: A copy of the technical proposal or white paper submitted by Atomic Machines, Inc. in response to any DARPA Broad Agency Announcement (BAA) or Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR/STTR) solicitation.

Evaluations & Rejections: In cases where a proposal was submitted but not awarded, provide the "Technical Evaluation" and "Selection/Non-Selection" letters.

Statements of Work (SOW): Detailed SOWs or "Milestone Schedules" that describe the specific MEMS fabrication capabilities or "Matter Compiler" benchmarks the company is contracted to deliver.

Communications: All correspondence (emails, letters, meeting minutes) between Jeff Holden or Klaus Zietlow (CTO) and DARPA Program Managers regarding the "foundational" or "dual-use" applications of their technology.

If certain parts of this request or certain portions must be redacted please provide any reasonable segregable portion of a requested record after removing or redacting those portions claimed to be exempt, explain in writing the justification for redacting the record, indicate the extent of any redactions on the portion of the record which is made available or published and where technically feasible indicate on the redacted portion itself the specific exemption(s) claimed.

Thank you for DARPA's commitment to transparency.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

communications.subject: Re: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Officers and Reports on 2025-6-19
communications.communication:
The Colorado Springs Police Department (“CSPD”) has received your records request dated 1/30/26, and it is under review. The records you have requested are considered criminal justice records as defined in Colorado Revised Statute § 24-72-302(4) which are held in the sole possession of CSPD, a law enforcement agency.  The Colorado Criminal Justice Records Act (“CCJRA”) as codified in C.R.S. § 24-72-301 et. seq. governs the release of criminal justice records.  The time response deadlines contained within CORA do not apply to requests for criminal justice records governed by the CCJRA.


Caitlin Ford Blanco

Colorado Springs Police Department

communications.subject: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Unedited BWC Footage for 2025-06-19
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All unedited body-worn camera / bodycam recordings related to the following law enforcement critical incident:

Incident Date: June 19th 2025 9:00 PM - 10:00 PM
Location: 130 S Nevada Ave, Colorado Springs, CO 80903
Victim Name: Forrest Andrew

I am specifically requesting the unedited body-worn camera recordings captured by all officers present for the full duration of the incident, including audio recordings associated with the footage.

If any portion of the requested footage must be redacted, I ask that you clearly indicate the portions that have been redacted and provide an explanation of the legal basis for the redactions. If the requested footage is withheld in its entirety, please provide a detailed explanation citing relevant public records exemption(s).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jessie Proffitt

communications.subject: Re: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Unedited BWC Footage for 2025-06-19
communications.communication:
The Colorado Springs Police Department (“CSPD”) has received your records request dated 1/30/26, and it is under review. The records you have requested are considered criminal justice records as defined in Colorado Revised Statute § 24-72-302(4) which are held in the sole possession of CSPD, a law enforcement agency.  The Colorado Criminal Justice Records Act (“CCJRA”) as codified in C.R.S. § 24-72-301 et. seq. governs the release of criminal justice records.  The time response deadlines contained within CORA do not apply to requests for criminal justice records governed by the CCJRA.


Caitlin Ford Blanco

Sr. Public Communications Specialist

Colorado Springs Police Department

719-444-7621 (office)

Caitlin.ford@coloradosprings.gov<mailto:Caitlin.ford@coloradosprings.gov>

communications.communication:
The records you have requested are defined criminal justice records under the Colorado Criminal Justice Records Act (“CCJRA”) in C.R.S. § 24-72-302(4).  Based upon the current open and active status of the CSPD’s investigation into the incident, the official custodian has determined that release of the requested records would be contrary to the public interest pursuant to C.R.S. § 24-72-305(5).  Additionally, record requests for records of official action (as defined in C.R.S. § 24-72-302(7)) are denied pursuant to C.R.S. § 24-72-305(1)(b).

title: Police Information Sharing Policies with Immigration Authorities

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Police Information Sharing Policies with Immigration Authorities
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records: 

1. All departmental or municipal policies regarding communication and information sharing between departmental officers or employees and federal agents/agencies within the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) or the U.S. Department of Homeland Security (DHS), including but not limited to the U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE). The records request includes, but is not limited to, policies regarding: 

A. Fingerprint and other data sharing, 

B. ICE detainer requests,   

C. Compliance with federal immigration enforcement efforts, including guidance or policies around when communication with ICE officers is allowed, and 

D. Communicating with federal immigration enforcement officers. 

This request covers any policies that are currently in effect or that have been in effect at any point on or after January 20, 2025. 

2. The three most recent communications (e.g., emails, text messages, call logs or transcripts, or otherwise) between a departmental officer or employee and a federal DHS or ICE employee. In addition, I request all records related to these communications, including, but not limited to, any records indicating that the department was made aware of the communications, discussions of their content or implications, evaluations them for compliance with departmental or other city policies, identification or acknowledgement of any potential policy violations, and any internal responses, disciplinary actions, or follow-up measures resulting from these communications. 

3. All records relating to incidents, if any, from January 20, 2025, to the day this request is responded to, in which an individual was taken from the department’s custody directly into ICE custody. For each incident, the records request includes, but is not limited to, booking and transfer records, communications with ICE or other federal agencies, internal documentation or discussion of the transfer, and internal notes, memos, or documentation referencing communication with DHS or ICE.

For each request, I am not seeking identifying information, and I will accept anonymized or redacted data as necessary to protect identities. 

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest. I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Joshua Dankoff 

Joshuadankoff@cfjj.org  

Director of Strategic Initiatives 

Citizens for Juvenile Justice  

(submitted via MuckRock platform)

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Subject: FOIA Request – Officer Narratives / Arrest & Incident Reports for Specified Case Numbers (Harvey Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (5 ILCS 140), I request electronic copies of the full Arrest/Incident Reports for the case numbers listed below, including the Officer Narrative(s) and any supplemental narrative(s) / supplements contained in the report package.

These case numbers were identified from the Arrest Log previously provided by the Harvey Police Department. I am NOT requesting any video or audio at this time—only the written reports.

List of Requested Cases (RMS-friendly format; listed in the body of this request):

1) Case/Report # HV-25-00007225 — Arrest/Incident Date/Time 03/23/2025 — Name UNKNOWN (as listed) — Primary Offense DUI — Location E 154TH ST / HALSTED

Preferred Format & Delivery:
Please provide the records in PDF format and deliver them electronically (via the MuckRock portal/email).

Fees:
I agree to pay reasonable fees authorized under 5 ILCS 140/6. Please notify me in advance if the total fees are expected to exceed $50 before you incur any costs.

Redactions / Segregability:
If any portion of a record is exempt from disclosure, please redact only the exempt portion(s) and release all reasonably segregable non-exempt material.

If any part of this request is unclear or you believe it is unduly burdensome, please contact me and I will promptly work with you to clarify or narrow the request.

Thank you for your time and assistance.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

William Benjamin Johnson

communications.communication:

All unedited body-worn camera / bodycam recordings related to the following law enforcement critical incident:

Incident Date: July 5th 1:37 AM - 2:15 AM
Location: Pikes Peak and Tejon
Victim Name: Alex Martinez-Sarmiento or Alex Martinez

I am specifically requesting the unedited body-worn camera recordings captured by all officers present for the full duration of the incident, including audio recordings associated with the footage.

If any portion of the requested footage must be redacted, I ask that you clearly indicate the portions that have been redacted and provide an explanation of the legal basis for the redactions. If the requested footage is withheld in its entirety, please provide a detailed explanation citing relevant public records exemption(s).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jessie Proffitt

communications.communication:
The Colorado Springs Police Department (“CSPD”) has received your records request dated 1/30/26, and it is under review. The records you have requested are considered criminal justice records as defined in Colorado Revised Statute § 24-72-302(4) which are held in the sole possession of CSPD, a law enforcement agency.  The Colorado Criminal Justice Records Act (“CCJRA”) as codified in C.R.S. § 24-72-301 et. seq. governs the release of criminal justice records.  The time response deadlines contained within CORA do not apply to requests for criminal justice records governed by the CCJRA.
